glsa.title: SquirrelMail: Remote Code Execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in SquirrelMail might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: SquirrelMail is a webmail package written in PHP. It supports IMAP and SMTP and can optionally be installed with SQL support.

description.p: It was discovered that the sendmail.cf file is mishandled in a popen call.

impact.p: A remote attacker, by enticing a user to open an e-mail attachment, could execute arbitrary shell commands.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Gentoo has discontinued support for SquirrelMail and recommends that users unmerge the package:
